solution_line_template: Five dozens of people is equal to {dozens_of_people} x {items_per_dozen} = <<{dozens_of_people}*{items_per_dozen}={total_people}>>{total_people}.
{total_people} x {cans_per_person} = <<{total_people}*{cans_per_person}={total_cans_needed}>>{total_cans_needed} cans of soda are needed.
So, this means {total_cans_needed}/{cans_per_box} = <<{total_cans_needed}/{cans_per_box}={boxes_needed}>>{boxes_needed} boxes of soda must be purchased.
Thus, it will amount to ${cost_per_box} x {boxes_needed} = $<<{cost_per_box}*{boxes_needed}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
Therefore, each family member will pay ${total_cost}/{family_members} = $<<{total_cost}/{family_members}={cost_per_family_member}>>{cost_per_family_member}.
